thread.title: College student lives in tiny solar-powered house
thread.title_full: College student lives in tiny solar-powered house

author: The Associated Press
title: College student lives in tiny solar-powered house
text:
Home / Brief / College student lives in tiny solar-powered house College student lives in tiny solar-powered house By: The Associated Press August 17, 2015 4:03 pm 0 Rob Dunn’s two-story, 96-square-foot home sits in the woods in Poultney, Vermont. Dunn has lived off the grid for about a year in his tiny home powered by two 100-watt solar panels. (AP Photo: Anthony Edwards/Rutland Herald) 
POULTNEY, Vt. — A college student in Vermont is living in a 96-square-foot house he built to reduce his carbon footprint — and save money. 
The Rutland Herald reports that Green Mountain College senior Rob Dunn has been living in the two-story Poultney home since August 2014. 
The home is powered by two 100-watt solar panels. A rocket mass heater built from a cast-iron stove insulated with a mixture of clay, sand and straw allows for cooking and heating. 
The home cost Dunn about $3,000 to build, and the landowner is letting him live rent-free. He says that will help with the high cost of college. 
The Henniker, New Hampshire, native says living in the home is the “most raw experience that I’ve ever had.” Share this:
